question.text: What share of global energy will come from renewable sources in 2050?

config.context: Current renewable share: ~15% (2024). Paris targets: 60-70% by 2050. Key uncertainties: policy ambition, battery/storage costs, grid infrastructure, fossil fuel phase-out pace, nuclear expansion.

uncertainties.name: AI Productivity Revolution
uncertainties.description: The speed and scale of AI adoption across industries will determine whether economies experience modest efficiency gains or transformative productivity growth that fundamentally reshapes GDP potential
uncertainties.low_state: AI adoption remains confined to narrow applications with incremental productivity gains of 1-3% annually, similar to previous technology waves
uncertainties.high_state: AI drives revolutionary productivity growth of 5-10% annually across sectors through autonomous systems, scientific breakthroughs, and radical workflow transformation
signals: By December 2027, at least 5 Fortune 500 companies report >25% productivity gains from AI implementation in their annual SEC filings
Before January 2029, global AI chip demand exceeds $800 billion annually, per Semiconductor Industry Association data
By June 2028, autonomous AI systems successfully conduct >50% of drug discovery trials for at least 3 major pharmaceutical companies, per FDA records
Before December 2030, AI-powered automation replaces >40% of white-collar jobs in at least 2 G7 countries, per OECD employment statistics
By January 2029, AI systems achieve breakthrough discoveries leading to >10 new patents filed per day by Fortune 1000 companies, per USPTO data

uncertainties.name: Global Economic Fragmentation
uncertainties.description: The degree of international economic integration versus fragmentation into regional blocs will determine whether global GDP benefits from specialization and scale or suffers from reduced efficiency and duplicated infrastructure
uncertainties.low_state: World fragments into competing economic blocs with limited trade, duplicated supply chains, and nationalist energy policies reducing global efficiency
uncertainties.high_state: Deep global integration continues with seamless renewable energy trade, shared infrastructure investments, and coordinated transition policies maximizing economic efficiency
signals: By December 2028, global trade as percentage of world GDP falls below 45% for two consecutive years, per WTO statistics
Before January 2030, at least 4 major economies implement comprehensive restrictions on renewable energy technology exports, per IEA tracking
By June 2029, cross-border renewable energy investments drop >60% from 2024 levels, per IRENA annual investment reports
Before December 2027, China and US bilateral trade falls below $400 billion annually, per official customs data from both countries
By January 2031, fewer than 15 countries participate in integrated renewable energy grid projects spanning multiple continents, per International Energy Agency records

signals.text: By December 2027, at least 5 Fortune 500 companies report >25% productivity gains from AI implementation in their annual SEC filings
Before January 2029, global AI chip demand exceeds $800 billion annually, per Semiconductor Industry Association data
By June 2028, autonomous AI systems successfully conduct >50% of drug discovery trials for at least 3 major pharmaceutical companies, per FDA records

By January 2031, fewer than 15 countries participate in integrated renewable energy grid projects spanning multiple continents, per International Energy Agency records

scenarios.name: AI-Powered Green Surge
scenarios.description: Revolutionary AI productivity drives massive investment in renewable infrastructure while maintaining global cooperation. AI optimizes renewable systems, accelerates R&D, and enables efficient global green technology deployment through integrated markets.

uncertainty_states.AI Productivity Revolution: AI drives revolutionary productivity growth of 5-10% annually across sectors through autonomous systems, scientific breakthroughs, and radical workflow transformation
uncertainty_states.Global Economic Fragmentation: Deep global integration continues with seamless renewable energy trade, shared infrastructure investments, and coordinated transition policies maximizing economic efficiency

scenarios.why_exclusive: Cannot coexist with fragmented world as it requires global AI/renewable technology flows and coordination that fragmentation prevents
signals: By December 2027, at least 5 Fortune 500 companies report >25% productivity gains from AI implementation in their annual SEC filings
Before January 2029, global AI chip demand exceeds $800 billion annually, per Semiconductor Industry Association data
By June 2028, autonomous AI systems successfully conduct >50% of drug discovery trials for at least 3 major pharmaceutical companies, per FDA records
By January 2029, AI systems achieve breakthrough discoveries leading to >10 new patents filed per day by Fortune 1000 companies, per USPTO data

scenarios.name: Fragmented Transition Struggle
scenarios.description: Economic nationalism creates isolated renewable development with duplicated efforts and reduced efficiency. Limited technology sharing and trade barriers slow the global energy transition despite some regional progress.

uncertainty_states.AI Productivity Revolution: AI adoption remains confined to narrow applications with incremental productivity gains of 1-3% annually, similar to previous technology waves
uncertainty_states.Global Economic Fragmentation: World fragments into competing economic blocs with limited trade, duplicated supply chains, and nationalist energy policies reducing global efficiency

scenarios.why_exclusive: Cannot coexist with AI revolution or global integration as it represents fundamental barriers to both technological advancement and international cooperation
signals: By December 2028, global trade as percentage of world GDP falls below 45% for two consecutive years, per WTO statistics
Before January 2030, at least 4 major economies implement comprehensive restrictions on renewable energy technology exports, per IEA tracking
By June 2029, cross-border renewable energy investments drop >60% from 2024 levels, per IRENA annual investment reports
Before December 2027, China and US bilateral trade falls below $400 billion annually, per official customs data from both countries
By January 2031, fewer than 15 countries participate in integrated renewable energy grid projects spanning multiple continents, per International Energy Agency records

indicator_bundle.Technology transfer restrictions: >50% of major economies with export controls

scenarios.name: AI-Driven National Champions
scenarios.description: AI revolution occurs within fragmented world, creating highly efficient but isolated renewable systems. Each major bloc develops advanced but incompatible green technologies, achieving significant but uncoordinated progress.

uncertainty_states.AI Productivity Revolution: AI drives revolutionary productivity growth of 5-10% annually across sectors through autonomous systems, scientific breakthroughs, and radical workflow transformation
uncertainty_states.Global Economic Fragmentation: World fragments into competing economic blocs with limited trade, duplicated supply chains, and nationalist energy policies reducing global efficiency

scenarios.why_exclusive: Cannot coexist with global integration scenario as fragmentation prevents optimal AI deployment, and cannot match integrated AI scenario's efficiency gains
signals: Before January 2029, global AI chip demand exceeds $800 billion annually, per Semiconductor Industry Association data
By January 2029, AI systems achieve breakthrough discoveries leading to >10 new patents filed per day by Fortune 1000 companies, per USPTO data
By December 2028, global trade as percentage of world GDP falls below 45% for two consecutive years, per WTO statistics
Before January 2030, at least 4 major economies implement comprehensive restrictions on renewable energy technology exports, per IEA tracking

scenarios.name: Steady Global Progress
scenarios.description: Incremental AI improvements support coordinated but gradual renewable transition. Global cooperation enables steady technology sharing and infrastructure development at moderate pace, achieving Paris-aligned outcomes through sustained effort.

uncertainty_states.AI Productivity Revolution: AI adoption remains confined to narrow applications with incremental productivity gains of 1-3% annually, similar to previous technology waves
uncertainty_states.Global Economic Fragmentation: Deep global integration continues with seamless renewable energy trade, shared infrastructure investments, and coordinated transition policies maximizing economic efficiency

scenarios.why_exclusive: Represents moderate outcomes that cannot coexist with either revolutionary AI gains or fragmentation barriers that would push outcomes to other ranges
signals: By December 2027, at least 5 Fortune 500 companies report >25% productivity gains from AI implementation in their annual SEC filings
By June 2028, autonomous AI systems successfully conduct >50% of drug discovery trials for at least 3 major pharmaceutical companies, per FDA records

mece_reasoning: These four scenarios are mutually exclusive and collectively exhaustive by mapping the 2x2 uncertainty matrix to distinct renewable energy outcome ranges. Each uncertainty combination creates different dynamics: (1) AI Revolution + Integration enables optimal global deployment (85-95%), (2) Limited AI + Fragmentation creates inefficient isolated development (35-50%), (3) AI Revolution + Fragmentation produces competing national systems (55-70%), and (4) Limited AI + Integration allows steady coordinated progress (60-75%). The scenarios cannot co-occur because they represent fundamentally different global system states - you cannot simultaneously have fragmented and integrated markets, or both revolutionary and incremental AI productivity. The outcome ranges are exclusive because they reflect the cumulative impact of these different system configurations on renewable deployment efficiency, investment flows, and technological development rates.
